items.question: 1. What does Scrum@Scale certification entail?
items.answer: The Scrum@Scale certification equips you with the necessary expertise to scale Scrum and Lean product development across multiple cross-functional teams aiming for a shared objective. It provides a framework for Scrum teams to solve intricate challenges while delivering maximum product value.

items.question: 2. Are there any prerequisites for joining the Scrum@Scale course?
items.answer: While there are no mandatory prerequisites, having a CSM/CSPO credential or practical experience with Scrum is highly recommended. We also advise reviewing the official Scrum@Scale guide before the first day of class.

items.question: 3. What are the advantages of becoming Scrum@Scale certified?
items.answer: Earning this certification offers numerous perks for both individuals and companies: it boosts productivity, reduces costs, enhances work quality, and fosters a collaborative atmosphere. Practitioners see significant career growth, can manage enterprise-level Scrum metrics, and help remove barriers to scaling, leading to improved project outcomes and client satisfaction.

items.question: 4. What is the process for getting Scrum@Scale certified?
items.answer: To get certified, you must first finish the Scrum@Scale training through an Authorized Training Organization (ATO). Afterwards, you'll receive a registration link to set up your profiles with Scrum Inc. You then need to pass the online exam with a score of at least 75% (correctly answering 23 out of 30 questions). The exam is open-book and untimed.

items.question: 5. How long does the Scrum@Scale credential remain valid?
items.answer: The certification is valid for a period of two years, after which it must be renewed.

items.question: 6. How soon after the training should I take the certification exam?
items.answer: Once you have successfully completed your training, you are free to take the certification exam at a time that is most convenient for you.

items.question: 7. What can I expect from the Scrum@Scale exam format?
items.answer: The exam is an open-book assessment with no time restrictions. You must achieve a pass mark of 75% or higher, which means getting at least 23 out of the 30 questions right.
